items.title: Trump’s Union Order Endangers Federal Prison Officers, Labor Leaders Say
items.description: Supporters of the union, which represents 30,000 prison employees, fear the move will worsen an ongoing staffing crisis.

items.title: How States Are Undoing Criminal Justice Reforms
items.description: Louisiana, New York and other states are rolling back reforms — and efforts to reduce excessive sentencing or expand parole are smaller in scope.

items.title: Anatomy of a Prison Death
items.description: It’s stressful when anyone dies on your wing, especially when no one ever tells you what happened.

items.title: Judge Celebrezze Now Admits to Allegations of Case Steering in Lucrative Divorce Cases
items.description: Cuyahoga County judge’s shift puts her seat in jeopardy as a disciplinary hearing and FBI investigation loom, following Marshall Project reporting.

items.title: A Court May Soon Control the Hinds County Jail. Here’s What May Happen Next.
items.description: When death and violence plagued the jail, the federal courts stepped in. We talked with an expert about what to expect from a receivership.
